info.title: norderney API
info.description: This is the definition of the norderney API. Essentially it is a work in progress, so things are bound to change a lot. The specification for OpenAPI can be found [here](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md). The rest of the documentation can be found [here](../build/html/index.html).

servers.description: The URL to the API service.

get.description: Returns the program name and version of the server, so the client can determine if he is compatible.

get.summary: Returns a list of all simulation data on the server.
get.description: Returns a listing of all the simulation data that is available in the directory, that the server is serving from.

200.description: A list with the simulation data that is available on the server.

get.summary: Returns a list of all active scenes on the server.
get.description: Get a listing of all scene_hashes (that is: a listing of all scenes) available.

post.summary: Create a new scene with some datasets.
post.description: Create a new scene with a list of datasets that are used for initialization.

requestBody.description: A list of datasets to be added to the new scene. Duplicates are allowed.

200.description: New scene created. Complete success, all datasets could be added. The response contains a list with datasets that were added to the simulation.

206.description: New scene created. Partial success, some datasets could not be added. The response contains a list with added datasets and a list with datasets, that could not be added.

404.description: Could not create new scene - none of the requested datasets exist.

get.summary: Get a listing of all datasets in this scene.

200.description: A list of all the datasets in this scene.

post.summary: Add one or more dataset(s) to the scene.

requestBody.description: A list of datasets to add to the scene.

200.description: Complete success, all datasets could be added. The response contains a list with datasets that were added to the scene.

206.description: New scene created. Partial success, some datasets could not be added. The response contains a list with added datasets and a list with datasets, that could not be added.

get.summary: Get all the information about this dataset.
get.description: Returns information about this dataset. Like available timesteps, simulation subsets (temp, etc), orientation, ... unclear what exactly, so WIP.

delete.summary: Delete this dataset from the scene.

get.summary: Get the orientation of this dataset.

patch.summary: Alter the orientation of this dataset.

requestBody.description: A list of datasets to add to the scene.

get.summary: Returns the current and selected timestep(s).
get.description: Returns the currently selected and available timestep(s) of this dataset.

patch.summary: Sets the current timestep to one that is available.

requestBody.description: The timestep to select. The `index` is referring to the `datasetTimesteps` array that has been returned in the GET method.

get.summary: Returns the current and displayable field(s).
get.description: Returns the currently displayed field and the displayable fields (temperature, etc) of this dataset.

patch.summary: Sets the displayed field to one that is available.

requestBody.description: A list of datasets to add to the scene.

get.description: Returns the complete mesh data, including hashes, geometry and field.

get.summary: Returns the geometry and field hash for the mesh data.
get.description: Returns the geometry and field hash for the mesh data.

availableDatasets.description: A list of available datasets on the server.

activeScenes.description: A list with active scenes on the server.

loadedDataset.description: The name, unique identifier and alias of a dataset that is loaded into a scene.

datasetName.description: The folder name as present on the server.

datasetHash.description: A unique identifier assigned to the dataset on the time of adding it to the scene.

datasetAlias.description: An alias for the dataset to be able to differentiate two identical datasets in a scene.

datasetHref.description: A link to the dataset in the scene.

href.description: A link to a page that exists.

listOfLoadedDatasets.description: Get the datasets that are loaded in a scene

href.description: A link to the scene that the object belonged to.

orientationResponse.description: The metadata and orientation of an dataset

setTimestep.description: A single timestep in a dataset

timestepResponse.description: The metadata and timestep information of an dataset

setField.description: A single field in a dataset.

name.description: The name of a nodal or elemental field.

fieldResponse.description: The metadata and field information of an dataset

datasetFieldList.description: A list of available fields for an dataset.

name.description: The name of a nodal or elemental field.

meshResponse.description: The metadata and field information of an dataset

datasetMeshHash.description: The hash for the geometry that is currently served.

datasetSurfaceNodes.description: The {x, y, z} coordinates of the nodes in the order {x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, ...}.

datasetSurfaceTets.description: The ordering of the nodes to for tetrahedra. Every three-tuple refers to a set of three sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

datasetSurfaceFreeEdges.description: The nodes that make up the free edges of the model. Every two-tuple refers to two sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

datasetSurfaceWireframe.description: The nodes that make up the wireframe of the model. Every two-tuple refers to two sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

datasetFieldHash.description: The hash for the field that is currently served.

datasetSurfaceField.description: The field values for every surface node of the model. Every value refers to one single node.

meshHashResponse.description: The metadata and field information of an dataset

datasetMeshHash.description: The hash for the geometry that is currently served.

datasetFieldHash.description: The hash for the field that is currently served.

meshGeometryResponse.description: The geometry information of a dataset

datasetMeshHash.description: The hash for the geometry that is currently served.

datasetSurfaceNodes.description: The {x, y, z} coordinates of the nodes in the order {x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, ...}.

datasetSurfaceTets.description: The ordering of the nodes to for tetrahedra. Every three-tuple refers to a set of three sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

datasetSurfaceFreeEdges.description: The nodes that make up the free edges of the model. Every two-tuple refers to two sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

datasetSurfaceWireframe.description: The nodes that make up the wireframe of the model. Every two-tuple refers to two sets of {x, y, z} coordinates from the datasetSurfaceNodes.

meshFieldResponse.description: The surface field information of a dataset

datasetFieldHash.description: The hash for the field that is currently served.

datasetSurfaceField.description: The field values for every surface node of the model. Every value refers to one single node.

addDatasetsSuccess.description: The response on successfully creating a new scene.

sceneHash.description: The unique identifier for the scene.

href.description: A link to the new scene.

addDatasetsSuccess.description: An array with JSON objects containing information about datasets.

addDatasetsPartial.description: The response on partially creating a new scene.

sceneHash.description: The unique identifier for the scene.

addDatasetsSuccess.description: An array with JSON objects containing information about datasets.

addDatasetsFail.description: An array of datasets that could not be added to the scene.

mesh_200.description: Mesh data (hash, geometry, field) for the requested dataset.

mesh_hash_200.description: Mesh hash data for the requested dataset.

mesh_geometry_200.description: Mesh geometry data for the requested dataset.

mesh_field_200.description: Mesh field data for the requested dataset.

schema.description: A default error message and code.
